ddf.catalog.resource

Interface ResourceReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Describable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CatalogStore, ConnectedSource, FederatedSource, RegistryStore, RemoteSource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCswSource, AbstractCswStore, ContentResourceReader, CswSourceImpl, OgcUrlResourceReader, OpenSearchSource, RegistryStoreImpl, TwitterSource, URLResourceReader, WfsSource, WfsSource

    public interface ResourceReader
extends Describable
    A ResourceReader is used to obtain a Resource. For example the URLResourceReader obtains a Resource based on supported URI schemes.
    Author:
    michael.menousek@lmco.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<String> getOptions(Metacard metacard)
      Obtain a set of all options supported by this ResourceReader.
      Set<String> getSupportedSchemes()
      Returns a set of URI schemes that the ResourceReader can accept when doing a Resource lookup.
      ResourceResponse retrieveResource(URI uri, Map<String,Serializable> arguments)
      Retrieves a Resource based on a URI and provided arguments.

      • Methods inherited from interface ddf.catalog.util.Describable

        getDescription, getId, getOrganization, getTitle, getVersion

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveResource

        ResourceResponse retrieveResource(URI uri,
                                  Map<String,Serializable> arguments)
                           throws IOException,
                                  ResourceNotFoundException,
                                  ResourceNotSupportedException
        Retrieves a Resource based on a URI and provided arguments.
        Parameters:
        uri - A URI that defines what Resource to retrieve and how to do it.
        arguments - Any additional arguments that should be passed to the ResourceReader.
        Returns:
        A ResourceResponse containing the retrieved Resource.
        Throws:
        {@link - IOException} thrown typically when there is an issue retrieving the file
        {@link - ResourceNotFoundException} thrown when the Resource could not be found
        {@link - ResourceNotSupportedException} thrown when the Resource is not supported by the ResourceReader
        IOException
        ResourceNotFoundException
        ResourceNotSupportedException

      • getSupportedSchemes

        Set<String> getSupportedSchemes()
        Returns a set of URI schemes that the ResourceReader can accept when doing a Resource lookup. Custom schemes can be created for a ResourceReader to support.
        Returns:
        Set of supported schemes

      • getOptions

        Set<String> getOptions(Metacard metacard)
        Obtain a set of all options supported by this ResourceReader. Options are used to obtain the Resource in a unique way.
        Parameters:
        metacard -
        Returns:
        Set of all options that this ResourceReader supports. This will be an empty set if no options are supported.
